div.p: Letter press copy book 2, p. 145, Queensland Herbarium, Brisbane.

I feel loathe to trouble you on so small a matter as a few fern specimens but know no one else on your island to whom I could apply. I send you a copy of a work which I have just got out 'Lithograms of Queensland ferns'. On plate 171 fig. 5 is given an impression of a species which so far as at present known is only to met with near a waterhole on Thursday Island fig 4 also in Queensland has only so far been met within the same locality. All that at present is known of fig. 5 is from a few specimens sent to me for determination by the Doctor of the ["Alert"] ([...] [...]) amongst was this what I considered but a form of N. fragilis Hook . I gave the fragments to Dr Prentice who sent them to Baron Mueller by whom they were sent to Professor [Luersen] This is the history of the little Thursday Island fern of which I now ask you to obtain specimens for me, but there is growing with it still another new fern of which I should be glad of specimens —
